edu.uab.ssg.io.decode

Class GenotypeFileParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.uab.ssg.io.decode.GenotypeFileParser

  • public final class GenotypeFileParser
extends Object
    A parser for the genotype file format used by deCODE to report genotyping results from a custom Illumina SNP array. Here is a short example:

    [Header]
    BSGT Version 3.2.32
    Processing Date 8/27/2008 4:12 PM
    Content iSelect_JHY_273439_A.bpm
    Num SNPs 7295
    Total SNPs 7800
    Num Samples 2306
    Total Samples 2306
    [Data]
    SNP Name Sample ID Allele1 - Top Allele2 - Top Allele1 - Forward Allele2 - Forward GC Score
    AICDA-007875 AVA1001 G G C C 0.4495
    AICDA-007902 AVA1001 G G C C 0.7680
    AICDA-007922 AVA1001 G G G G 0.2848
    ...

    In this file format, missing alleles are coded with the '-' character (i.e. the hyphen, minus sign) and the data table record delimiter is the tab character. The file format is described in more detail in this MS Word document. Read more about the "TOP/BOT" strand in this technical note from Illumina.

    Author:
    Jelai Wang

    • Method Detail

      • parse

        public void parse(InputStream in,
                  GenotypeFileParser.RecordListener listener)
           throws IOException
        Parses the input stream for genotype records.
        Parameters:
        in - The input stream, typically a file input stream, of the file to be parsed.
        listener - As the input stream is parsed, each genotype record is passed to the user-supplied record listener.
        Throws:
        IOException
